Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ocellatin-PT1 (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: Skin Secretion, dorsal,Leptodactylus pustulatus, South America

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (88%) toOcellatin-PT4Activity: it has leishmanicidal activity (IC50 23.9 uM). Not active against E.coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 300 uM), K.pneumoniae ATCC 700603 (MIC >300 uM), S.choleraesuis ATCC 14028 (MIC >300 uM), and S.aureus ATCC 29313 (MIC >300 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Oliveira M, Gomes-Alves AG, Sousa C, Mirta Marani M, Plácido A, Vale N, Delerue-Matos C, Gameiro P, Kückelhaus SA, Tomas AM, S A Leite JR, Eaton P.2016
Literature Information.Title: Ocellatin-PT antimicrobial peptides: High-resolution microscopy studies in antileishmania models and interactions with mimetic membrane systems
